verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> is the substance <S%G5287><s%> of things <S%G4229><s%> hoped <S%G1679><s%> for, the evidence <S%G1650><s%> of things not seen. <S%G991><s%>
For by it the elders <S%G4245><s%> obtained <S%G3140><s%> a good report. <S%G3140><s%>

Through faith <S%G4102><s%> we understand <S%G3539><s%> that the worlds <S%G165><s%> were framed <S%G2675><s%> by the word <S%G4487><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> so <S%G1519><s%> that things which <S%G3588><s%> are seen <S%G991><s%> were not made <S%G1096><s%> of things which do appear. <S%G5316><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Abel <S%G6><s%> offered <S%G4374><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> a more excellent <S%G4119><s%> sacrifice <S%G2378><s%> than <S%G3844><s%> Cain, <S%G2535><s%> by which <S%G3739><s%> he obtained <S%G3140><s%> witness <S%G3140><s%> that he was righteous, <S%G1342><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> testifying <S%G3140><s%> of his gifts: <S%G1435><s%> and by it he being dead <S%G599><s%> yet <S%G2089><s%> speaks. <S%G2980><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Enoch <S%G1802><s%> was translated <S%G3346><s%> that he should not see <S%G1492><s%> death; <S%G2288><s%> and was not found, <S%G2147><s%> because <S%G1360><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> had translated <S%G3346><s%> him: for before <S%G4253><s%> his translation <S%G3331><s%> he had this testimony, <S%G3140><s%> that he pleased <S%G2100><s%> God. <S%G2316><s%>

But without <S%G5565><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> it is impossible <S%G102><s%> to please <S%G2100><s%> him: for he that comes <S%G4334><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> must <S%G1163><s%> believe <S%G4100><s%> that he is, and that he is a rewarder <S%G3406><s%> of them that diligently <S%G1567><s%> seek <S%G1567><s%> him.

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Noah, <S%G3575><s%> being warned <S%G5537><s%> of God of things not seen <S%G991><s%> as yet, <S%G3369><s%> moved <S%G2125><s%> with fear, <S%G2125><s%> prepared <S%G2680><s%> an ark <S%G2787><s%> to the saving <S%G4991><s%> of his house; <S%G3624><s%> by the which <S%G3739><s%> he condemned <S%G2632><s%> the world, <S%G2889><s%> and became <S%G1096><s%> heir <S%G2818><s%> of the righteousness <S%G1343><s%> which is by faith. <S%G4102><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> when he was called <S%G2564><s%> to go <S%G1831><s%> out into <S%G1519><s%> a place <S%G5117><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> he should <S%G3195><s%> after <S%G3195><s%> receive <S%G2983><s%> for an inheritance, <S%G2817><s%> obeyed; <S%G5219><s%> and he went <S%G1831><s%> out, not knowing <S%G1987><s%> where <S%G4226><s%> he went. <S%G2064><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> he sojourned <S%G3939><s%> in the land <S%G1093><s%> of promise, <S%G1860><s%> as in a strange <S%G245><s%> country, dwelling <S%G2730><s%> in tabernacles <S%G4633><s%> with Isaac <S%G2464><s%> and Jacob, <S%G2384><s%> the heirs <S%G4789><s%> with him of the same promise: <S%G1860><s%>
For he looked <S%G1551><s%> for a city <S%G4172><s%> which has <S%G2192><s%> foundations, <S%G2310><s%> whose <S%G3739><s%> builder <S%G5079><s%> and maker <S%G1217><s%> is God. <S%G2316><s%>

Through faith <S%G4102><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> Sara <S%G4564><s%> herself <S%G846><s%> received <S%G2983><s%> strength <S%G1411><s%> to conceive <S%G2602><s%> seed, <S%G4690><s%> and was delivered <S%G5088><s%> of a child <S%G5088><s%> when she was past <S%G3844><s%> age, <S%G2244><s%> because <S%G1893><s%> she judged <S%G2233><s%> him faithful <S%G4103><s%> who had promised. <S%G1861><s%>

Therefore <S%G1352><s%> sprang <S%G1080><s%> there even <S%G2532><s%> of one, <S%G1520><s%> and him as good as dead, <S%G3499><s%> so many as the stars <S%G798><s%> of the sky <S%G3772><s%> in multitude, <S%G4128><s%> and as the sand <S%G285><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> is by the sea <S%G2281><s%> shore <S%G5491><s%> innumerable. <S%G382><s%>

These <S%G3778><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> died <S%G599><s%> in faith, <S%G4102><s%> not having received <S%G2983><s%> the promises, <S%G1860><s%> but having seen <S%G1492><s%> them afar <S%G4207><s%> off, and were persuaded <S%G3982><s%> of them, and embraced <S%G782><s%> them, and confessed <S%G3670><s%> that they were strangers <S%G3581><s%> and pilgrims <S%G3927><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the earth. <S%G1093><s%>
For they that say <S%G3004><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> things declare <S%G1718><s%> plainly <S%G1718><s%> that they seek <S%G1934><s%> a country. <S%G3968><s%>

And truly, <S%G3303><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> they had been mindful <S%G3421><s%> of that country from where <S%G3739><s%> they came <S%G1831><s%> out, they might have <S%G2192><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> opportunity <S%G2540><s%> to have returned. <S%G344><s%>

But now <S%G3570><s%> they desire <S%G3713><s%> a better <S%G2909><s%> country, that is, an heavenly: <S%G2032><s%> why <S%G1352><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> is not ashamed <S%G1870><s%> to be called <S%G1941><s%> their God: <S%G2316><s%> for he has prepared <S%G2090><s%> for them a city. <S%G4172><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Abraham, <S%G11><s%> when he was tried, <S%G3985><s%> offered <S%G4374><s%> up Isaac: <S%G2464><s%> and he that had received <S%G324><s%> the promises <S%G1860><s%> offered <S%G4374><s%> up his only <S%G3439><s%> begotten <S%G3439><s%> son,
Of whom <S%G3739><s%> it was said, <S%G2980><s%> That in Isaac <S%G2464><s%> shall your seed <S%G4690><s%> be called: <S%G2564><s%>

Accounting <S%G3049><s%> that God <S%G2316><s%> was able <S%G1415><s%> to raise <S%G1453><s%> him up, even <S%G2532><s%> from the dead; <S%G3498><s%> from where <S%G3606><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> he received <S%G2865><s%> him in a figure. <S%G3850><s%>
By faith <S%G4102><s%> Isaac <S%G2464><s%> blessed <S%G2127><s%> Jacob <S%G2384><s%> and Esau <S%G2269><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> things to come. <S%G3195><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Jacob, <S%G2384><s%> when he was a dying, <S%G599><s%> blessed <S%G2127><s%> both <S%G1538><s%> the sons <S%G5207><s%> of Joseph; <S%G2501><s%> and worshipped, <S%G4352><s%> leaning on the top <S%G206><s%> of his staff. <S%G4464><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Joseph, <S%G2501><s%> when he died, <S%G5053><s%> made <S%G3421><s%> mention <S%G3421><s%> of the departing <S%G1841><s%> of the children <S%G5207><s%> of Israel; <S%G2474><s%> and gave commandment <S%G1781><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> his bones. <S%G3747><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Moses, <S%G3475><s%> when he was born, <S%G1080><s%> was hid <S%G2928><s%> three <S%G5150><s%> months <S%G5150><s%> of his parents, <S%G3962><s%> because <S%G1360><s%> they saw <S%G1492><s%> he was a proper <S%G791><s%> child; <S%G3813><s%> and they were not afraid <S%G5399><s%> of the king's <S%G935><s%> commandment. <S%G1297><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> Moses, <S%G3475><s%> when he was come <S%G1096><s%> to years, <S%G1096><s%> <S%G3173><s%> refused <S%G720><s%> to be called <S%G3004><s%> the son <S%G5207><s%> of Pharaoh's <S%G5328><s%> daughter; <S%G2364><s%>

Choosing <S%G138><s%> rather <S%G3123><s%> to suffer <S%G4778><s%> affliction <S%G4778><s%> with the people <S%G2992><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> to enjoy <S%G2192><s%> <S%G619><s%> the pleasures <S%G2237><s%> of sin <S%G266><s%> for a season; <S%G4340><s%>

Esteeming <S%G2233><s%> the reproach <S%G3680><s%> of Christ <S%G5547><s%> greater <S%G3187><s%> riches <S%G4149><s%> than the treasures <S%G2344><s%> in Egypt: <S%G125><s%> for he had respect <S%G578><s%> to the recompense <S%G3405><s%> of the reward. <S%G3405><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> he forsook <S%G2641><s%> Egypt, <S%G125><s%> not fearing <S%G5399><s%> the wrath <S%G2372><s%> of the king: <S%G935><s%> for he endured, <S%G2594><s%> as seeing <S%G3708><s%> him who is invisible. <S%G517><s%>

Through faith <S%G4102><s%> he kept <S%G4160><s%> the passover, <S%G3957><s%> and the sprinkling <S%G4378><s%> of blood, <S%G129><s%> lest <S%G2443><s%> <S%G3361><s%> he that destroyed <S%G3645><s%> the firstborn <S%G4416><s%> should touch <S%G2345><s%> them.

By faith <S%G4102><s%> they passed <S%G1224><s%> through <S%G1224><s%> the Red <S%G2281><s%> sea <S%G2281><s%> as by dry <S%G3584><s%> land: which <S%G3739><s%> the Egyptians <S%G124><s%> assaying <S%G3984><s%> <S%G2983><s%> to do were drowned. <S%G2666><s%>
By faith <S%G4102><s%> the walls <S%G5038><s%> of Jericho <S%G2410><s%> fell <S%G4098><s%> down, after they were compassed <S%G2944><s%> about <S%G2944><s%> seven <S%G2033><s%> days. <S%G2250><s%>

By faith <S%G4102><s%> the harlot <S%G4204><s%> Rahab <S%G4460><s%> perished <S%G4881><s%> not with them that believed <S%G544><s%> not, when she had received <S%G1209><s%> the spies <S%G2685><s%> with peace. <S%G1515><s%>

And what <S%G5101><s%> shall I more <S%G2089><s%> say? <S%G3004><s%> for the time <S%G5550><s%> would fail <S%G1952><s%> me to tell <S%G1334><s%> of Gedeon, <S%G1066><s%> and of Barak, <S%G913><s%> and of Samson, <S%G4546><s%> and of Jephthae; <S%G2422><s%> of David <S%G1138><s%> also, <S%G5037><s%> and Samuel, <S%G4545><s%> and of the prophets: <S%G4396><s%>

Who <S%G3739><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> subdued <S%G2610><s%> kingdoms, <S%G932><s%> worked <S%G2038><s%> righteousness, <S%G1343><s%> obtained <S%G2013><s%> promises, <S%G1860><s%> stopped <S%G5420><s%> the mouths <S%G4750><s%> of lions. <S%G3023><s%>

Quenched <S%G4570><s%> the violence <S%G1411><s%> of fire, <S%G4442><s%> escaped <S%G5343><s%> the edge <S%G4750><s%> of the sword, <S%G3162><s%> out of weakness <S%G769><s%> were made <S%G1743><s%> strong, <S%G1743><s%> waxed <S%G1096><s%> valiant <S%G2478><s%> in fight, <S%G4171><s%> turned <S%G2827><s%> to flight <S%G5437><s%> the armies <S%G3925><s%> of the aliens. <S%G245><s%>

Women <S%G1135><s%> received <S%G2983><s%> their dead <S%G3498><s%> raised <S%G386><s%> to life again: <S%G386><s%> and others <S%G243><s%> were tortured, <S%G5178><s%> not accepting <S%G4327><s%> deliverance; <S%G629><s%> that they might obtain <S%G5177><s%> a better <S%G2909><s%> resurrection: <S%G386><s%>

And others <S%G2087><s%> had <S%G2983><s%> trial <S%G3984><s%> of cruel mockings <S%G1701><s%> and scourgings, <S%G3148><s%> yes, <S%G1161><s%> moreover <S%G1161><s%> of bonds <S%G1199><s%> and imprisonment: <S%G5438><s%>

They were stoned, <S%G3034><s%> they were sawn <S%G4249><s%> asunder, <S%G4249><s%> were tempted, <S%G3985><s%> were slain <S%G1722><s%> with the sword: <S%G3162><s%> they wandered <S%G4022><s%> about <S%G4022><s%> in sheepskins <S%G3374><s%> and goatskins; <S%G122><s%> <S%G1192><s%> being destitute, <S%G5302><s%> afflicted, <S%G2346><s%> tormented; <S%G2558><s%>

(Of whom <S%G3739><s%> the world <S%G2889><s%> was not worthy: <S%G514><s%>) they wandered <S%G4105><s%> in deserts, <S%G2047><s%> and in mountains, <S%G3735><s%> and in dens <S%G4693><s%> and caves <S%G3692><s%> of the earth. <S%G1093><s%>
And these <S%G3778><s%> all, <S%G3956><s%> having obtained <S%G3140><s%> a good report <S%G3140><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> faith, <S%G4102><s%> received <S%G2865><s%> not the promise: <S%G1860><s%>
God <S%G2316><s%> having provided <S%G4265><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> better <S%G2909><s%> thing for us, that they without <S%G5565><s%> us should not be made <S%G5048><s%> perfect. <S%G5048><s%>
